newsitem.title: FRANCE: French oil stocks gain on UN delay of Iraq sales.
newsitem.headline: French oil stocks gain on UN delay of Iraq sales.

text.p: Shares in French oil groups Elf Aquitaine and Total were among the biggest gainers in the CAC-40 share index on Monday, buoyed by the United Nations' plans to delay Iraq's re-entry to world oil markets.
Brokers said the stocks were also helped by expectations of strong first-half results, helped by the dollar's gains. Total reports its earnings on Wednesday evening and Elf on Thursday.
Shares in Total were up five francs, or 1.34 percent, at 377.50, while Elf shares were up 8.20 francs, or 2.22 percent, at 377 at 1435 GMT. The CAC-40 index was up 0.37 percent.

Iraqi military activity in the Kurdish north prompted the U.N. to put on hold a planned humanitarian Iraqi oil-for-food exchange, stopping the first sales of Iraqi oil since the Gulf War six years ago.
